[color=#f6b26b][size=4]Description:[/size][/color]
It’s all in the name. That’s right, with Guild Starter, you can now start your very own guild. Recruit almost ANYONE to join a guild commanded by you. Once you've found a nice home base(aka headquarters) and recruited up to 10 guild members, the possibilities become endless! Send your guild members on jobs, have them follow you, and level up your guild. Be a hunting guild, a necromancer guild, a mining guild, a cooking guild, an apothecary guild, an archer guild, a fight club, an assassin’s guild, a bandit clan, a treasure-hunting guild, a group of skooma smugglers, a paladin guild, and the list goes on infinitely. I've put many many hours of work into this mod, heck, I’m writing this at 2:35 AM because I've been working on it all night. So download, endorse, and make YOUR guild.


[color=#f6b26b][size=4]Starting Your Guild:[/size][/color]
1. Find a good place in Skyrim for your guild headquarters.
2. Locate the ‘HQ Marker’ in your inventory and drop it in the center of your Guild HQ
3. Name your guild. *see ‘Naming your guild’ below
4. Locate the ‘Recruiting Necklace’ in your inventory and equip it
5. Ask nearly anyone to join your guild. There is a max of 10 guild members



[color=#f6b26b][size=4]Managing Your Guild:[/size][/color]
To start commanding your guild members, talk to them and say “I have something to tell you”

[color=#fce5cd][size=3]Giving Jobs:[/size][/color]
[list]Talk to your recruit and say “I have a job for you”. Then choose any job from the list. You are then prompted to choose a location. Depending on the job you choose, your relationship with the hold in that location may change.[/list]
[color=#fce5cd][size=3]Collecting rewards from jobs:[/size][/color]
[list]Talk to your recruit and say “Give me what you've collected from jobs”. The menu that opens can be used for taking any item from your recruit. Upon closing the menu, you will receive the gold reward (if any).[/list]
[color=#fce5cd][size=3]Dressing your recruits:[/size][/color]
[list]Talk to your recruit and say “Give me what you've collected from jobs”. Take all of the armor and clothing out of their inventory, talk to them again and give them whatever outfit you want them to wear. Finally, tell them “Equip the armor in your inventory”[/list]
[color=#fce5cd][size=3]Have a recruit follow you:[/size][/color]
[list]Talk to your recruit and say “Follow me”. To send them back to the headquarters, tell them “Patrol the headquarters”.[/list]
[color=#fce5cd][size=3]Recruit follower commands:[/size][/color]
[list][*][size=2]“Wait Here.”
[/size][/*]
[*][size=2]“Let me teach you a new combat style”
[/size][/*]
[*][size=2]“Become protected. You will no longer be able to die by the hands of enemies.”
[/size][/*]
[*][size=2]“Let me trade some things with you.”[/size][/*]
[/list][size=1]*Note: none of these commands will conflict with any additional follower mods.[/size]

[color=#fce5cd][size=3]Have a recruit[originally one of your followers] follow you:[/size][/color]
[list]Talk to your recruit and say “Take a break from patrolling the headquarters”.[/list]
[color=#fce5cd][size=3]Naming your guild:[/size][/color]
[list]Go to the MCM menu and start typing in your guild name. It will show up in the top-left corner of the menu.[/list]
[color=#fce5cd][size=3]Dismiss a recruit:[/size][/color]
[list]Talk to your recruit and say “I have something to tell you” and then “Sorry, but I have to let you go.” They will no longer be a part of your guild, and you must recruit someone else to take their spot.[/list]


[color=#f6b26b][size=4]Leveling and Perks:[/size][/color]
When you assign enough jobs, your guild will level up and, as guild master, you can choose certain perks for the guild. Every time your guild levels up, you will receive 1 guild perk point. You can then spend it on perks. Each perk has a unique effect on what kind of guild you are.

[color=#fce5cd][size=3]Managing Perks:[/size][/color]
[list]If you have perk points to spend, then just click on the perk you want. you can change perks at any time just by reclicking them.[/list]



[color=#f6b26b][size=4]Relations [WIP]:[/size][/color]
Every time you assign a job, you are affecting the people and the world around you. So if you send your recruits on good-hearted jobs, people will like you more, and perhaps even lower prices for you. However, if you send recruits on jobs to steal from helpless old ladies or rip the hearts out of beggars, people won’t take too kindly to that, and, naturally, they will put a bounty on your head.
You can see your reputation with a hold in the MCM menu.



[color=#f6b26b][size=4]Required:[/size][/color]
SKSE and SKYUI

[color=#fce5cd][size=3]Recommended:[/size][/color]
[list][*][size=2][url=http://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/21037/?]Custom Sigils by Hoax 2[/url]: create your own guild logo and display it on shields and cloaks!
[/size][/*]
[*][size=2][url=http://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/25068/?]Placeable Statics by Iceburg[/url]: create and place any furniture(including banners) in your guild headquarters!
[/size][/*]
[*][size=2][url=http://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/57376/?]Multiple Floors Sandboxing by Dovahklon[/url]: this mod allows your guild members to walk up and down stairs and between multiple levels when they are hanging out at the headquarters.[/size][/*]
[/list]

[color=#f6b26b][size=4]Compatibility:[/size][/color]
Compatible with all follower mods. For some reason there is a myth out there that this mod isn't, but I assure you that it is.
Now that that’s out of the way, EVERYTHING should be compatible with this mod. I have not experienced, nor had someone report an incompatibility.

[color=#f6b26b][size=4]Installation:[/size][/color]
use NMM or unpack the rar and place the files in their corresponding folders

[color=#f6b26b][size=4]Uninstallation:[/size][/color]
Use NMM or delete all of the ‘guildstarter’ files
